oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
EQUAL SUFFRAGE LEAGUE MEMBERS TO MEET
Mrs. L. C. French, president of the Knoxville Equal Suffrage league will be at home this afternoon from 2:30 to four four o'clock, when members of the league and friends are invited for informal discussion of the live questions of the day, which will he led by Mr. Collier, formerly of Memphis, speaking on "The Future of Democracy." The meetings of the league are monthly, and the next regular meeting will not be held until Saturday, February 25th. In order that members who have more time to give to a study of the questions with which the league is concerned may do so, the home of the president is to be thrown open informally every Saturday afternoon. Mrs. French will either lead the discussions or invite some person well informed to do so, and the presence of Mr. Collier at this afternoon's meeting promises unusual interest. Mr. Collier is one of the best informed young men in the state and is well known to most of her citizens. He has lived for a number of years in New York, which city is at present his home. At the regular meeting last Saturday afternoon, there was a general and spirited discussion on the need of good government along the lines of birth registration, child labor and compulsory education.
